sentences: "Hallo, ma kuulen." "Hallo, kas see on ekskursioonibüroo?"
"Hallo, hallo! Pidage kinni!" hüüdis ta mulle järele.
context: In Estonian, 'pidage' is the plural imperative form of the verb 'pidama', which means 'to hold', 'to keep', or 'to maintain'. It's used when addressing multiple people. In the given example sentence, it appears as part of the phrase 'Pidage kinni!' which translates to 'Hold on!' or 'Wait!' - an instruction for a group of people to wait or stay put.
